solution_line_template: So he scored {num_games_in_season}*{points_per_game_from_touchdowns}=<<{num_games_in_season}*{points_per_game_from_touchdowns}={total_points_from_touchdowns}>>{total_points_from_touchdowns} points from touchdowns

He also scored {points_per_conversion}*{num_conversions}=<<{points_per_conversion}*{num_conversions}={total_points_from_conversions}>>{total_points_from_conversions} points from the {points_per_conversion} point conversions

So he scored a total of {total_points_from_touchdowns}+{total_points_from_conversions}=<<{total_points_from_touchdowns}+{total_points_from_conversions}={james_total_points}>>{james_total_points} points
That means he beat the old record by {james_total_points}-{old_record_points}=<<{james_total_points}-{old_record_points}={points_beat_record_by}>>{points_beat_record_by} points
